org.prebake.core
Class Glob

java.lang.Object
  org.prebake.core.Glob
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Glob>, JsonSerializable
@ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public final class Glob
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Glob>, JsonSerializable

A pattern that matches a group of files.

Parts of the below talk about normalized paths. Normalized paths use / to separate individual file and directory names instead of using the system dependent separator. E.g., on Windows, the normalized form of C:\foo is C:/foo.

Tree Roots

A glob may specify that a prefix of all paths matched by it is the root of a directory tree, such as
  • Portion of a C header file include directory,
  • A java package tree,
  • The root of files in a JAR or ZIP archive,
  • The directory to contain the index.html file in a tree of HTML reports,
  • etc.
The tree root of a glob is the prefix of it that precedes 3 path separators. E.g. the tree root of src///org/prebake/**.java is src, and the rest of the prefix, /org/prebake are path elements under the tree root. That glob matches paths like src/org/prebake/Foo.java ; the paths it matches do not have to have tripled file separators.

See Also:

Field Detail

CONV

public static final YSONConverter<com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<Glob>> CONV
Does shell-style expansion of {foo,bar} sections to produce a list of globs from a single input glob. E.g. foo/**.{html,js,css} would expand to the globs [foo/**.html, foo/**.js, foo/**.css].

public static boolean overlaps(java.lang.Iterable<Glob> unionA,

transform

public static com.google.common.base.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> transform(Glob input,
                                                                                           Glob output)
                                                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
A function that transforms paths that match the input glob into paths that match the output glob.

Returns:
a function that takes a normalized path (/ as the separator) relative to the client root and returns a normalized path relative to the client root. The function will return null if the path does not match the input glob.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

commonPrefix

public static java.lang.String commonPrefix(java.lang.Iterable<Glob> globs)
A prefix common to all these globs that is also a path that is an ancestor (non-strict) of all paths matched by any of the input globs.

Returns:
"" if there are no inputs.

match

public boolean match(java.lang.String path,
                     @Nullable

True iff this glob matches the given path given the given bindings.

Parameters:
parameterBindings - if non-null, then any named parameters must match keys that are present in the given bindings map. If the match is successful any parameters whose names were not in the map will be put into this map.
